title: 108_hr2504
content: The Act titled "Student Loan Fairness Consolidation Act of 2003" allows for the refinancing of existing consolidation loans. The Student Loan Fairness Consolidation Act of 2003 allows borrowers to refinance existing consolidation loans at a variable interest rate, excluding loans used solely to repay certain types of loans. Additionally, terms for Federal Direct Consolidation Loans are adjusted to align with FFEL Consolidation Loans. The Student Loan Fairness Consolidation Act of 2003 allows borrowers to refinance existing consolidation loans at a variable interest rate. Section 428C is renamed as 'Federal Direct Consolidation Loans'. Section 428C is renamed as 'Federal Direct Consolidation Loans'. SEC. 3. AVAILABILITY OF VARIABLE INTEREST RATE CONSOLIDATION LOANS. The Student Loan Fairness Consolidation Act of 2003 allows borrowers to refinance existing consolidation loans at a variable interest rate. Section 427A of the Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include provisions for Variable Interest Rate Consolidation Loans with specific interest rate calculations. The Student Loan Fairness Consolidation Act of 2003 allows borrowers to refinance consolidation loans at a variable interest rate. If the interest rate exceeds the special allowance rate, excess interest is credited to the Government based on a calculation involving the loan balance and interest rates. The Student Loan Fairness Consolidation Act of 2003 allows borrowers to refinance consolidation loans at a variable interest rate, with excess interest credited to the Government based on a calculation involving the loan balance and interest rates. The Student Loan Fairness Consolidation Act of 2003 allows borrowers to refinance consolidation loans at a variable interest rate determined by the bond equivalent rate of 91-day Treasury bills plus 2.3 percent, capped at 8.25 percent. This provision does not apply to consolidation loans used solely to repay section 428B loans or Federal Direct PLUS Loans. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to section 438(b)(2)(I) by including section 427A(m) in the list of applicable sections.
